name: Americana Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is a small five-story, family owned hotel in the midst of many high-rise hotels, condos, etc. At first glance, I was a little nervous about my decision to stay here. However, when we checked in, I was immediately impressed with the cleanliness of the lobby. I don't think I've ever stayed at a hotel where the rooms were so clean and fresh smelling. The beds were comfortable, and the air conditioner kept the room comfortably cool without being noisy. Even though our room faced the freeway, it was one of the quietest hotel rooms we've ever stayed at. Never heard people in other rooms--even showering, walking in the halls, etc. Free continental breakfast each morning - large selection of donuts, bagels, croissants, pastries, orange juice and coffee. Within easy walking distance of the Metro (blue/yellow lines) and two shopping areas with food courts. Only paid $79 per night for a double which included free parking--$90 cheaper than one of the least expensive chain hotels in the same general area. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!
reviews.title: Would recommend the Americana to anyone on a budget visiting DC
Basic clean rooms at an unbeatable price
reviews.text: Americana is a bit of a throwback to the 1960s (50s?) but has basic clean rooms at an unbeatable price.

One negative is that there are keyed locks that don't lock automatically. In other words, when you leave or enter your room and close the door behind you, it will NOT be locked unless you actively lock it.
reviews.title: Inexpensive But I Question The Safety
Looks scary, but not bad!
reviews.text: The Americana is located close to the metro (3-4 blocks), though you do have to walk on a dirt trail adjacent to an empty lot and then underneath the Jefferson Davis Highway to reach it.

We used to live right next to the Americana when we lived in Arlington, and we referred family there all the time. It's inexpensive and very clean. I needed to stay in the DC area on short notice for two nights in March, so I went with the Americana. Yes, it's inexpensive and clean. But the furnishing are really old. The phone looked like it was 20 years old and the sound on it kept going in and out. But the real dealbreaker was the door lock. Someone could easily break into your room. The hotel is not in a bad part of town by any means, but I noticed some homeless people out and about at night. My wife was thinking of staying here in a few months on her next trip to DC, and there's no way I would feel comfortable with her here given my concerns about safety. I'd much rather that she pay an extra $100 to stay in a nice, secure location.
reviews.title: Great value, good location, not bad
Clean, comfortable, and friendly
reviews.text: Looks kinda scary from the outside, but the hotel was clean inside and the rooms were nice enough. Good breakfast. FYI...the walls are a little thin.

We stayed at the Americana 3 nights and when we got our first glimpse, we were a little scared of what was in store for us. However we were pleasently surprised. The staff is wonderfull, helpfull, and full of information on the area and DC. The rooms were really basic but comfortable. They have a washer and dryer available for use and even provide the soap, you do have to pay for the dryer though.
reviews.title: Looks Scarry, But looks can be decieving
You'll be so proud of yourself.
reviews.text: As for the safety, we walked around the area at night and did not feel at all unsafe in the area or in the hotel. The metro is indeed with in walking distance, especially if you take the short cut through the Marriott.

reviews.title: DC's most affordable in the safest area!
reviews.text: If you are looking for comfortable and affordable we definately suggest the Americana, just prepare your self for the appearence, it is not the Marriott. If we ever come back to the area though, we will definately stay at the Americana.

reviews.title: Best Value in DC Area
reviews.text: My husband and I first started using TripAdvisor when we were planning for our honeymoon approximately one year ago. We utilized TripAdvisor once again when we planned a summer vacation to Washington DC. Intially, we were very disappointed because we couldn't find accomodations which met various criteria (free breakfast, parking, close to Metro) and our budget. Frustrated and about to cancel the trip, my husband found the Americana. I was skeptical at first due to references to the decor and the lack of some contemporary services. Yet, after our stay at the Americana, the services the staff provided were many of the intangibles which make a vacation so memorable.

description: Americana Hotel is ideally situated in a neighborhood in Arlington, Virginia called Crystal City across the Potomac River from Washington, D.C. Since 1963, our family-owned-and-operated hotel near Washington D.C. has never wavered from its commitment to complete guest satisfaction with every stay. Business and leisure travelers alike are sure to appreciate our comfortable Arlington hotel accommodations and well-appointed Crystal City hotel amenities that include free shuttle service and a complimentary continental breakfast. We are only 1 mile from the Nation’s capital and within walking distance of two Metro stops. Please call us today and let us help you plan your next trip to Washington, DC!
